name: Dinner Tonight: Honey-Chipotle Arepas
description: This is not where I figured I'd end up. I had made some chorizo and wanted a simple side dish to soak up the porky goodness. Since I was out of tortillas, and didn't feel like making my own, I...

recipeInstructions.text: Mix the cornmeal, salt, boiling water, olive oil, honey, and chipotle in a large bowl. Stir until there are no lumps. If the mixture is too wet add more cornmeal. It should be a solid mass but still sticky. Set the bowl aside for 15 minutes.
Dump the mixture out on a large cutting board, and divide into 4 equal sections. Flatten each piece to about 1/2 inch thick using a spatula.
Preheat a griddle or a large skillet to medium-high heat. Brush the surface with canola oil. Add the cornmeal mixture and cook until golden brown on each side, about a minute or two.
